subject: Re: UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library  already loaded in another classloader
msgSnippet: ... BIN ocijdbc9.dll ... Well, with Bernd s thin driver suggestion, I am able to avoid the real issue. All the JUnit-based tests can now be invoked together
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bernd" <berndq@g...> wrote:
>
> > UnsatisfiedLinkError: Native Library C:\oracle\ora90
\BIN\ocijdbc9.dll
> > already loaded in another classloader
> ...
> > Any suggestions or small examples for dealing with this DB/JUnit
> > issue?
>
> just some guesses:
>
> do you need the thick (oci) driver? Can you use use the thin driver?
> This will remove the dll-dependency.
>

Well, with Bernd's "thin driver" suggestion, I am able to avoid the
real issue. All the JUnit-based tests can now be invoked together
through Ant's <junit> task with 100% success. Also, my application
runs its system-level tests.
All I had to do was modify part of the connection string that I
passed to my getConnection():
connection_str = "jdbc:oracle:thin:@(description=(address=
(host= "
// connection_str = "jdbc:oracle:oci8:@(description=(address=
(host="
+ host + ")(protocol=tcp)(port=" + port +
"))(connect_data=(sid=" + sid + ")))";

But, I cannot announce any resolution or advice for the basic
classloader/problem.

> Have your tried the textui runner?

Even with the "thick-driver", I was able to invoke both of my test
suites through the TestRunner's SwingUI interface. I could select
each one in the "Test Class Name" choicebox and get successfull runs
as many times as I wanted.

Anyone care to make another suggestion concerning the Ant/JUnit setup
to fix the original classloader/library problem? Does anybody think
they have a test suite that successfully resolves a similar issue?

I was suprised that my attempts to implement the suggestion at:
http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#running_8
"Why do I get an error (ClassCastException or LinkageError) using the
GUI TestRunners"
had no effect.
But, I did not have the problem with the TestRunners, only Ant's
<junit> task. Hmmm...

>
> Bernd
>
> > Thanks
> > -Tim
> >
